description: a list of common 6-letter words followed by crossword/thesaurus-style hints for that word

bakery: where bread and cakes come from
dugout: canoe made from a tree trunk
exiles: those not allowed to return home
filler: something meant only to take up time
forget: be affected by a recall problem
frothy: like the head on a glass of beer
gargle: rinse the back of your throat
gerbil: rodent kept as a house pet
grains: base of the old food pyramid
haggle: try to get a better price
lander: able to descend to the surface
lender: on the giving end of a mortgage
mullet: business up front, party in the back
ninety: number of feet between baseball bases
poncho: blanket with a hole in it
remake: new version of an old film
reopen: officially look into a closed case
replay: second look in a sports broadcast
resets: turns it off and on again
scruff: place to pick up a cat
sensor: a device that measures physical properties
converts physical stimuli to electronic input
settle: reach an agreement out of court
sizzle: sound of butter in a frying pan
slower: less likely to win the race
snores: a good way to keep your partner awake
spells: gives the letters in a word
sweeps: wins every game in a series
